boat.name: Three Sisters
boat.full_description:
Built in 1896 for a Mr Ralph, 'Three Sisters' is an 18' open fishing boat used for summertime trawling and drift-netting for herring off Thorpeness, Suffolk. She was one of about 350 beach punts, but only one of possibly four remaining in commission. 

During the 1930s, an engine was fitted. She was fished by Percy Westrup until about 1952, fishing no. IH81, when she was sold to the Brinkleys at Orford being used as a work boat until being laid up ashore.

Bought by Robert Simper, she was totally rebuilt by Frank Knights (Shipwrights), Woodbridge in 1994.
boat.short_description: Built in Thorpeness as a beach fishing punt, 1896, for a Mr Ralph, she has been rebuilt by Robert Simper and takes part in traditional events on the River Deben.
